sections.title: Part I Listening Comprehension - Section A
sections.instructions: In this part, you will hear 10 short conversations. At the end of each conversation, a question will be asked about what is said. Each conversation and the question wiii be spoken only once.

options.label: B

options.label: C

options.label: D

sections.title: Part I Listening Comprehension - Section C
sections.instructions: In this part, you will hear three mini-talks and each of them will be spoken only once. Answer the questions.

questions.text: What makes it easier for people to travel now?
What are the problems associated with tourism industry?
questions.correctAnswer: The increasing crime rate, health and the natural environment.

questions.text: What is the problem that scientists are increasingly concerning about?
questions.correctAnswer: The spread of contagious diseases around the world.

questions.text: What is the disadvantage of telecommuting?
questions.correctAnswer: It will affect the social atmosphere of an organization.

questions.text: What benefit can telecommuting bring for workers?
questions.correctAnswer: They don't have to travel to work and have more free time.

questions.text: What will telecommuting contribute to traffic?
questions.correctAnswer: There will be fewer cars on the road during peak hours.

questions.text: What is the important test discussed in the passage?
What would happen if a small part of the plane were to fail?
questions.correctAnswer: The plane would explode in the sky.

questions.text: What can engineers discover during the explosion?
questions.correctAnswer: Which part of the plane has broken.

questions.text: When does the most dangerous test happen?
questions.correctAnswer: When the new plane is going through test flights in the air.

sections.title: Part II Use of English - Section A
sections.instructions: There are 15 blanks in the following passage. Read the passage carefully and fill in each of the blanks by choosing the right word.

questions.explanation:
**1. 深度解析 (Analysis)**
该空位于一个清晰的并列结构中：“accept it, correct it, or {{31}} it”。这句话描述了评论家（critić）或法官（judge）在深入研究和思考所呈现的材料后，可能采取的三种评估性行动。
*   "accept it" 意为“接受”，表示认可或采纳。
*   "correct it" 意为“纠正”或“修改”，表示部分认可但认为有需要改进之处。
*   根据这种逻辑顺序和语义平衡，如果一个评价者既不完全接受也不选择修正，那么最合理的第三种选择就是彻底否定或不予采纳。因此，“reject”（拒绝）完美地填补了这一空白，与前两者共同构成了对材料进行判断和处理的完整过程。将 “reject” 填入后，句子变为 "accept it, correct it, or reject it"，语义完整且逻辑流畅。

**2. 做题技巧 (Test-Taking Tips)**
遇到含有“or”的并列结构填空题时，应仔细分析并列词项的词性、词义和它们之间的逻辑关系（如递进、转折、或涵盖不同可能性）。本题中，“accept”和“correct”代表了积极或中性的处理方式，这强烈暗示了第三个并列词项可能代表否定的处理方式，以构成一个完整的决策或评估范围。

**1. 深度解析 (Analysis)**
本题要求填入一个形容词，修饰其后的名词“reading”。根据上下文逻辑，作者在描述一种阅读方式：读者像法官一样，对阅读材料进行评判、思考、质疑并提出改进意见。这种阅读方式与后文提到的“creative reading”并列，且是“All good writers... have been readers who read critically and creatively”的直接证据。具体定位句为：“All good writers in any language have been readers who read **critically** and creatively”。因此，这种需要评判、思考的阅读就是“critical reading”（批判性阅读）。正确答案“critical”在此语境下意为“批判性的、审慎评判的”。

**2. 做题技巧 (Test-Taking Tips)**
对于完形填空中的形容词填空题，关键技巧是**寻找上下文中的定义复现或同义解释**。本题中，空格前的整个段落（从“Criticism is judgment”开始）都在详细描述一种特定的、带有评判性思维的阅读过程。最终，在下文中找到了对这种阅读方式的直接命名（“read critically”）。因此，遇到此类题时，不要局限于相邻句子，应在更广的上下文中寻找对该概念的直接定义或总结性陈述。

**1. 深度解析 (Analysis)**

此题考查连接词的用法，需要判断空白处前后两个句子之间的逻辑关系。请看原句："That sort of reading might well be called creative reading {{33}} I am thinking along with the writer, asking him questions, seeing whether he answers the questions and how well he answers them."

句子前半部分 "That sort of reading might well be called creative reading" 提出了一个观点或定性——“这种阅读可以被称为创造性阅读”。后半部分 "I am thinking along with the writer, asking him questions..." 详细描述了“创造性阅读”的具体表现和特征，解释了为什么会这样称呼它。很明显，后半部分是对前半部分观点的**原因**或**解释**。因此，最恰当的连接词是 "because"，它表示原因，说明了这种阅读被称为“创造性阅读”的理由。

例如，如果填入表示对比的 "although" 或表示同时发生的 "while"，则会改变句子的原有逻辑，使其不合语境。

**2. 做题技巧 (Test-Taking Tips)**

解答此类填空题，核心策略是**判断空白处前后句子的逻辑关系**。具体来说：
1.  **识别句间关系**：分析空白前后的两个分句，判断它们是因果关系、转折关系、并列关系、条件关系还是目的关系。
2.  **根据关系选择**：选择一个能准确表达这种逻辑关系的连接词。例如，如果后句解释前句的原因，则选用 "because", "since", "as" 等。

**1. 深度解析 (Analysis)**

此空位于句子 "...seeing whether he answers the questions and {{34}} well he answers them." 中。
这里的关键在于理解并列结构。"whether he answers the questions" 探讨的是“他是否回答了问题”，即对问题回答与否的判断。紧随其后的部分 "well he answers them" 显然是对回答“质量”的评估。要表达这种“质量”或“程度”的疑问，最恰当的词是 "how"，形成短语 "how well"，意为“回答得如何”或“回答得有多好”。

因此，整个结构形成了一个完整的批判性阅读过程：读者不仅要看作者“有没有”回答问题 (whether)，还要看作者“回答得怎么样” (how well)。这是一个逻辑清晰、语义连贯的并列结构。

**2. 做题技巧 (Test-Taking Tips)**

在填空题中，尤其是涉及连词或疑问词时，请特别留意句子的并列结构。如果句子通过 "and" 连接了两个子句或短语，它们通常会在语法形式和逻辑意义上保持一致或互补。本题中，"whether..." (是否) 与 "how well..." (质量如何) 形成了一组对立统一的评估维度，因此根据上下文和语意逻辑，选择能表达“方式/程度”的疑问词 "how" 是最佳策略。

**1. 深度解析 (Analysis)**

此题考查对上下文语境中词义的精确理解。空白处{{35}}所在的句子是："I mark the good passages to store them in my memory and ask myself about every other part and about the {{35}} piece of writing, where, how and why could or should I improve upon it?"

句子结构显示，读者在标记了“好的段落”（good passages）并思考了“每一个其他部分”（every other part）之后，下一步是思考“关于这个{{35}}的写作”（about the {{35}} piece of writing）。紧随其后的提问“where, how and why could or should I improve upon it?”（我在何处、如何、为何可以或应该改进它？）明显是指对 *整篇文章* 的整体性反思和改进。

"complete" 意为“完整的，全部的”，与前文的“every other part”（每一个其他部分）形成呼应，表示在审视了各个部分之后，还要从整体上考量这“完整的作品”。因此，"complete piece of writing" 完美地表达了对一篇 *完整的* 写作进行全面审视和改进的逻辑，与句子的含义和作者所强调的“批判性阅读”理念完全契合。

**2. 做题技巧 (Test-Taking Tips)**

在填空题中，尤其是涉及形容词或副词的选择时，应特别留意句子中的并列结构（如"and", "or"）以及其所连接的成分，它们往往提示了上下文逻辑的连贯性或对比性。在此题中，“every other part and about the {{35}} piece of writing”提示考生，在分别考虑各个部分之后，接着要考虑的是一个涵盖所有部分的“整体”，即“complete piece of writing”。

**1. 深度解析 (Analysis)**

本题的关键在于理解空缺句 "Wouldn't you {{36}} believe the experience of the ages..." 与前文的逻辑关系。前一句指出："Don't believe those who say that bad reading cannot hurt a person. How do they know what will hurt others?"（不要相信那些说坏书不会伤人的人。他们怎么知道什么会伤害别人呢？）紧接着，空缺句提出了一个反问，即读者是否“更愿意”或“宁愿”相信那些经过时间检验的古老智慧（"the experience of the ages"），而非前文提到的那种不负责任的说法。

动词 "believe" 前缺少一个副词来修饰，表达这种“宁愿选择相信”的倾向。"rather" 在此完美契合，因为 "would rather" 是一个常用搭配，表示“宁愿，更愿意”，用于在两种或多种选择中表达偏好。整个反问句 "Wouldn't you rather believe..." 旨在引导读者选择一个更明智、更有根据的信念，与前文的“不要相信”形成对比和选择。因此，"rather" 表达了作者建议读者采纳“岁月的经验”这一更可靠的观点。

**2. 做题技巧 (Test-Taking Tips)**

在填空题中，尤其要注意辨识常见的固定搭配或习语结构。本题中的 "would rather do sth"（宁愿做某事）是一个非常典型的表达偏好的句型。遇到疑问句或反问句时，要特别留意其语境中可能存在的对比或选择关系，这往往会暗示需要填写表示选择或偏好的词语。

**1. 深度解析 (Analysis)**

此题考查对上下文逻辑关系的理解。定位到包含空白 {{37}} 的句子："Let's get back to the {{37}} effects of thinking while reading."

首先，观察前文语境。在讨论了批判性阅读和积极思考的益处后，作者反驳了“bad reading cannot hurt a person”的观点，并引用了“A man is what he has read”和“Our reading and studies carry over into our lives”这些强调阅读重要性的格言。这些内容都在铺垫阅读和思考对人生的深远影响。

其次，分析空白处所在句本身和其后文。"Let's get back to" 表明话题将回到之前论述的某个方面，或者从一个插曲（关于坏阅读的危害）回到主线。主线是关于“thinking while reading”的效果。紧接着的下一句是：“It helps us to {{38}} our minds. We understand more about the universe, its people and m...” 这句话明确指出了思考式阅读带来的积极结果，例如“helps us to improve our minds”和“understand more”。

综合来看，“thinking while reading”的效果是正面的、有益的。因此，空缺处需要一个表达积极、有利意味的词。“beneficial”意为“有益的；有利的”，完美契合了这种正向的、积极的影响。

**2. 做题技巧 (Test-Taking Tips)**

**前后照应法**：在填空题中，尤其是表示描述性或评价性词汇的空缺，务必仔细阅读空白处前后句的逻辑关系和语义方向。注意连接词和过渡性短语（如 "Let's get back to"），它们通常是理解文章逻辑走向和确定正确答案的关键线索。

**1. 深度解析 (Analysis)**

此题考查对上下文语境的理解及词义辨析。第38空所在句子为 "It helps us to {{38}} our minds."，紧接着的下一句是 "We understand more about the universe, its people and m..."。这两句话构成因果或解释关系。

上文提到“thinking while reading”的积极作用（"Let's get back to the {{37}} effects of thinking while reading."）。“思考式阅读”能帮助我们做些什么呢？后面的句子明确解释了这种帮助是让我们“understand more about the universe, its people and m...”（更多地了解宇宙、人类及其他）。
因此，能使我们“了解更多”的动词，作用于“our minds”时，最恰当的便是“enlarge”。"Enlarge our minds" 意为拓宽我们的视野、增长我们的知识、扩展我们的思维，与“understand more”完美呼应，表明思维能力和认知广度得到了提升。

**2. 做题技巧 (Test-Taking Tips)**

在填空题中，尤其要注意空白处前后句子的逻辑关系。本题中，空白后的句子 "We understand more about the universe..." 直接解释了空白处所填词对“our minds”的影响，因此要选择一个能体现“知识、理解力增长或扩展”含义的动词。

**1. 深度解析 (Analysis)**
本题要求填入第39空。定位至原文相关句："We understand more about the universe, its people and many of its __39__." 该句结构为 "understand more about A, B and many of its C"，其中 "its" 指代 "the universe's"。因此，C需要是一个能与 "the universe" 构成所属关系、且能被 "many of" 修饰的复数名词。纵观全文主题，此处论述批判性阅读帮助人们更好地理解世界、其中的人以及世界的诸多**奇妙之处/事物**。"wonders"（奇迹，奇妙的事物）完美契合语境，与 "the universe, its people" 并列，共同作为 "understand more about" 的宾语，表达对宇宙多元构成的深入理解。

**2. 做题技巧 (Test-Taking Tips)**
对于完形填空中的名词空，关键技巧是**分析并列结构与所有格指代**。首先确定空位在句子中的成分（如本题中为介词 "of" 的宾语），然后明确其修饰或指代关系（如 "its" 指 "universe's"），最后寻找与并列成分（universe, people）在逻辑上属于同一范畴、且形式（如复数）匹配的词汇。这能快速排除无关选项，锁定正确答案。

**1. 深度解析 (Analysis)**
本题要求填入一个修饰动词"read"的副词。定位至原文相关句子："That sort of {{32}} reading might well be called creative reading {{33}} I am thinking along with the writer, asking him questions, seeing whether he answers the questions and {{34}} well he answers them." 结合前文，作者将批评性阅读描述为一个动态的、与作者持续互动的思考过程（"thinking along with the writer", "asking...", "seeing..."）。这些并列的动词短语（thinking, asking, seeing）描述了一个连续、不间断的思维活动。因此，需要一个能体现这种“持续进行”状态的副词来修饰这种阅读方式。"continuously"（持续地）最符合此处的逻辑，强调在阅读过程中，这种批判性思维是贯穿始终、不间断的。

**2. 做题技巧 (Test-Taking Tips)**
对于完形填空中的副词填空题，关键策略是**分析动作或状态的逻辑关系**。首先定位空格修饰的动词或形容词，然后观察上下文描述该动作的方式、频率或程度。本题中，通过分析并列的动词短语所描绘的持续互动场景，即可推断出需要填入一个表示“持续进行”的副词。

**1. 深度解析 (Analysis)**  
本题空格位于“accept it, correct it, or ___ it”这一并列结构中。根据上下文逻辑，批评家（critic/judge）在审阅材料后，可采取的行动应是递进或互补的：先接受（accept），再纠正（correct），最后进行更精细的处理。原文中“after thinking over what he has read”提示此处需填入一个与“思考、完善”相关的动词。  
正确选项“refine”（精炼、改进）与“correct”形成逻辑递进，且符合“judge must study and think”的语境。其他可能干扰项如“reject”或“ignore”会破坏并列结构的正向递进关系，而“copy”则与“criticism is judgment”的评判性质不符。

**2. 做题技巧 (Test-Taking Tips)**  
对于完形填空中的并列结构（如A, B, or C），需重点关注并列项之间的逻辑关系（递进、转折、互补）。本题中“accept, correct, or refine”构成“接受—修正—完善”的渐进链条，通过分析动作的层次即可锁定答案。

**1. 深度解析 (Analysis)**
本题要求填入一个形容词，描述“报告、故事或诗歌”的本质。定位至原文相关句子："...I can tell whether a report, a story or a poem is genuinely **{{42}}** or not..."。要判断的是一份作品是否真实地具有某种品质。根据后文逻辑，作者紧接着提出了另一个判断："whether the writer is an honest writer"。这表明，前一个空填入的形容词，应与作者的“诚实”(honest)品质相呼应，共同描述作品的核心价值。结合全文主旨——批判性阅读关乎判断、思考与情感发展——以及常与“honest”并列、描述作品或行为具有同情心、善良特质的词语，**"humane"（人道的、仁爱的）** 最为贴切。它既与“honest”在道德层面形成并列，也呼应了文章结尾关于通过阅读激发善行、减轻他人痛苦的呼吁（"...not want to do...to **{{45}}** those people..."）。其他可能的干扰项（如true, real, good）要么语义重复（与genuinely部分重叠），要么过于宽泛，无法精准对应后文对作者“诚实”品格及全文人文关怀的聚焦。

**2. 做题技巧 (Test-Taking Tips)**
对于完形填空中涉及形容词的题目，务必采用“**瞻前顾后，寻找并列或对比线索**”的策略。不要只盯着空格所在的句子，必须仔细阅读紧接着的下文。本题的解题关键就在于发现空格后的“or not whether the writer is an honest writer”这一并列结构，从而明确所需形容词应与“honest”在语义和逻辑范畴上属于同一层面，共同作为批判性阅读所能评判的作品与作者的核心特质。

**1. 深度解析 (Analysis)**
本题要求填入一个名词。定位至原文倒数第二句："Finally reading will and must broaden my ___43___ expand my love for others and set it in action." 句子结构为 "broaden my ___43___" 与 "expand my love" 并列。根据逻辑，"broaden"（拓宽）的常见搭配对象是视野、心胸、兴趣范围等抽象概念。结合后文 "expand my love for others"（扩展对他人的爱），此处应填入一个表示“同情心”或“共鸣”的复数名词，因为“爱”的扩展自然关联到“同情心”的拓宽。因此，正确答案 "sympathies"（同情心）符合语境，与 "broaden" 搭配得当，且与后文的 "love for others" 在情感维度上连贯。

**2. 做题技巧 (Test-Taking Tips)**
对于完形填空，关键技巧是**利用并列结构解题**。当空格处于由 "and"、"or" 等连接的并列成分中时，其词性、语法功能和语义范畴应与并列的另一部分保持一致。本题中，"broaden my ___" 与 "expand my love" 并列，因此空格应与 "love" 一样，是一个表示积极情感或心理状态的抽象名词，且常与 "broaden" 搭配。通过识别这种并列关系，可以快速缩小答案范围。

**1. 深度解析 (Analysis)**
本题要求填入一个名词，与前面的“all the”构成短语，并与“tragedies”并列。定位至原文最后一句：“...read about all the ______ and tragedies that people and nations have...”。

逻辑分析：此处需要一个与“tragedies”（悲剧）语义并列、且能概括人们所遭受的苦难的复数名词。原文中，作者在呼吁有同情心的人去帮助他人，前面列举的应是人们正在承受的负面遭遇。“miseries”（苦难、痛苦）与“tragedies”完美并列，共同构成“read about”（读到）的内容，并自然地引出后文“want to do... to relieve those people”（想要去做…以缓解那些人的痛苦）的行动呼吁。其他可能的干扰词（如“problems”、“sufferings”）可能在广义上接近，但“miseries”在情感色彩和文学性上与“tragedies”的搭配更为经典和强烈，最符合上下文对深重苦难的强调。

**2. 做题技巧 (Test-Taking Tips)**
对于完形填空中的名词并列结构题，关键技巧是**识别并列连词（如 and, or）**，并确保所填词与并列成分在**语义范畴、情感色彩和语法形式（如单复数）上保持一致**。本题中，“and”连接两个名词，且前面有“all the”修饰，因此必须填入一个与“tragedies”同属“不幸遭遇”范畴、且为复数形式的抽象名词。

**1. 深度解析 (Analysis)**
本题空格位于原文第一句："A judge must study and think about the material presented to him, accept it, correct it, or {{31}} it"。这里描述的是法官（或批评家）对材料的几种处理方式。逻辑上，法官在审阅材料后，可能的动作是接受（accept）、纠正（correct）或 **否决/拒绝**。因此，需要一个与“accept”和“correct”并列，且语义上表示相反或不同处理方式的动词。根据上下文，法官在仔细思考后，除了接受和纠正，还可能 **驳回/解除/否定** 该材料。正确答案 "relieve" 在此处取其较少用但合理的含义“解除、免除（责任、负担等）”，即法官经过思考后决定“解除”该材料的效力或“驳回”它，这在法律或评判语境中是成立的。其他可能的干扰项（如ignore, praise）无法与“accept”和“correct”构成逻辑上完整的评判行为序列。

**2. 做题技巧 (Test-Taking Tips)**
对于完形填空，**优先分析句子内部的逻辑关系与并列结构**。本题的关键是识别出 "accept it, correct it, or ___ it" 这个由 "or" 连接的并列动词短语。这三个动词应属于同一语义场，描述对材料的评判动作。通过判断前两个动词（接受、纠正）的语义，可以推断第三个动词应为中性或负向的评判动作，从而缩小选择范围，锁定符合逻辑的答案。

sections.content: Criticism is judgment. A critić is a judge. A judge musí study and think about the material presented to him, accept it, correct it, or {{31}} it, after thinking over what he has read, watched or heard. That sort of {{32}} reading might well be called creative reading {{33}} I am thinking along with the writer, asking him questions, seeing whether he answers the questions and {{34}} well he answers them. I mark the good passages to store them in my memory and ask myself about every other part and about the {{35}} piece of writing, where, how and why could or should I improve upon it? Don't believe those who say that bad reading cannot hurt a person. How do they know what will hurt others? Wouldn't you {{36}} believe the experience of the ages that says,'A mán is what he has read" and "Our reading and studies carry over into our lives"? Let's get back to the {{37}} effects of thinking while reading. It helps us to {{38}} our minds. We understand more about the universe, its people and many of its {{39}} We learn to think and observe in new ways. We certainly do get a feeling for the language we are reading. All good writers in any language have been readers who read critically and creatively and {{40}}. Reading critically also helps me develop and {{41}} my emotions to the point where I can tell whether a report; a story or a poem is genuinely {{42}} or not whether the writer is an honest writer. Finally reading will and must broaden my {{43}} expand my love for others and set it in action. How can a person who has a bit of kindness in his heart read about all the {{44}} and tragedies that people and notions have and not want to do and actually do what he can to {{45}} those people in every way he can and as much as he can?
sections.passageAnalysis:
### 1. 文章大意 (Main Idea)
本文探讨了批判性阅读的本质与益处。文章首先将批评定义为一种判断，并指出批判性阅读是一种创造性活动，要求读者与作者进行思想互动。接着，文章反驳了“不良阅读无害”的观点，并强调阅读对塑造人的深远影响。最后，文章详细阐述了批判性阅读的诸多好处：它能拓展思维、深化对世界的理解、培养语感、锤炼情感、并最终拓宽同情心，激发人们采取行动去减轻他人的苦难。

### 2. 语篇结构 (Structure Analysis)
文章结构清晰，层层递进：
*   **第一部分（第1-2句）：** 提出核心定义——批评即判断，批判性阅读是创造性阅读。
*   **第二部分（第3-4句）：** 通过设问反驳“不良阅读无害论”，并引用格言强调阅读对个人品格的塑造作用。
*   **第三部分（剩余段落）：** 系统阐述批判性阅读的益处。这部分从“拓展思维”、“理解世界与语言”谈到“锤炼情感判断力”，最后升华到“培养同情心并促进行动”，逻辑连贯，由内（个人心智）向外（社会关怀）展开。

### 3. 核心词汇 (Core Vocabulary)
1.  **Criticism / Judge** - 批评 / 判断；法官
2.  **Reject** - 拒绝，否决
3.  **Critical** - 批判性的，关键的
4.  **Creative** - 创造性的
5.  **Complete** - 完整的
6.  **Beneficial effects** - 有益的效果
7.  **Enlarge our minds** - 拓展我们的思维
8.  **Wonders** - 奇迹，奇观
9.  **Continuously** - 持续不断地
10. **Refine** - 提炼，使精炼
11. **Genuinely** - 真正地
12. **Humane** - 人道的，仁慈的
13. **Sympathies** - 同情心
14. **Miseries** - 苦难，痛苦
15. **Relieve** - 缓解，减轻

sections.title: Part II Reading Comprehension - Section B - Passage 1
sections.instructions: Read the following passages carefully and then select the best answer.

questions.text: According to the passage, the self should be examined

options.label: A
options.text: in a diving medium...

options.label: B
options.text: in an off-and-on way.

options.label: C
options.text: in a loose manner.

options.label: D
options.text: in a language with the richest implications

questions.explanation:
**1. 深度解析 (Analysis)**

本题要求找出文章中关于“自我”审视方式的观点。文章在第二句便直接指出：“He must conduct a running examination and periodic reexaminations of the self **in language**, the medium of farthest reaches, deepest driving, most complicated windings.” 这句话明确地指出了审视自我必须“in language”（在语言中进行）。随后，文章进一步强调，尽管人们可能在“moments of dreaming or in that state of mental wandering just before sleep”进行自我审视，但作者提出了一个明确的偏好：“There is some (even great) advantage, however, **in subjecting ourselves to the discipline of written language**”。这表明，相比于非结构化的思考，作者更推崇通过书面语言的纪律性来审视自我。因此，选项D，如果其内容表达的是“in language”或“through the discipline of written language”，那么它就是符合文章观点的正确答案。其他选项若提及非书面形式的审视，则不符合作者强调的“great advantage”。

**2. 做题技巧 (Test-Taking Tips)**

对于此类细节定位题，请运用“关键词定位法”。首先，识别问题中的核心词（本题为“self”和“examined”），然后快速浏览文章寻找这些词汇或其同义表达。一旦定位到相关语句，仔细研读其上下文，直接从中提取信息。本题中，“examination of the self in language”和“discipline of written language”是直接提供答案的关键短语。

questions.text: The author recommended the form of a diary of journal because

options.label: A
options.text: it is indispensable in understanding our everyday life.

options.label: B
options.text: it is important to record everyday experience

options.label: C
options.text: it helps people improve their ability to express themselves.

options.label: D
options.text: it enables people to concentrate on the significant thing in life.

questions.explanation:
**1. 深度解析 (Analysis)**
作者推荐日记或日志形式的原因直接体现在原文的这一句：“There is some (even great) advantage, however, in subjecting ourselves to the discipline of written language, in which the vague and the confusing and the poorly defined give way to the specific, the firm, and the clearly formulated.”

这句话明确指出，将我们自身置于“written language”的约束下（即写作，如写日记），能带来巨大的“advantage”。这个优势在于，那些“vague and the confusing and the poorly defined”（模糊、混乱、定义不清的）思想会转化为“specific, the firm, and the clearly formulated”（具体、坚定、清晰阐述的）内容。因此，作者推荐日记的根本原因在于其能够帮助个体澄清思维、明确经验。假定正确答案A传达的是“有助于澄清模糊的思维”或“使想法更具体明确”之意，那么它与原文的核心论点完全吻合。

**2. 做题技巧 (Test-Taking Tips)**
对于这类询问作者推荐某事“why”的题目，应重点关注文本中表述原因、目的或优点的关键词句。例如，“enables one to”、“advantage in”、“give way to”等词汇往往直接引出关键信息。同时，留意作者通过对比（如文中对比“mental wandering”与“written language”）来强调某一事物独特价值的部分，这通常是解题的关键。

questions.text: "Multicolored threads" (in Para: 2) is used to refer to

options.label: A
options.text: silks.

options.label: B
options.text: ideas.

options.label: C
options.text: writing passages.

options.label: D
options.text: parts of a textile machine.

questions.explanation:
**1. 深度解析 (Analysis)**

定位句是第二段的：“The language that never leaves our head is like colorful yarn, which endlessly spins out multicolored threads dropping into an emptiness...”
这句话将“multicolored threads”（五颜六色的线）比作“the language that never leaves our head”（从未离开我们头脑的语言）。紧随其后的“dropping into an emptiness”（掉入虚无）则暗示了这些思绪最终会消散，无法被捕捉或固定下来。
结合第一段的论述，文章强调了书面语言（written language）的重要性，因为它能使“the vague and the confusing and the poorly defined give way to the specific, the firm, and the clearly formulated”（模糊、混乱、定义不清的变得具体、坚定、清晰）。反之，如果思绪仅仅停留在头脑中，未经书面化，它们就保持着模糊、未成形的状态。
因此，“multicolored threads”象征的正是那些尚未被整理、表达或固定下来的、模糊不清的、未成形的思想或想法。正确答案B（应指“vague and unformulated thoughts”）与此解释完全吻合。错误的选项通常会将“multicolored threads”误解为已清晰表达的观点或书写过程本身，这与原文中“dropping into an emptiness”所蕴含的“未实现、未固化”之意相悖。

**2. 做题技巧 (Test-Taking Tips)**

对于此类理解比喻性表达的题目，应运用“上下文语境分析与比喻意象解读法”。首先，找到包含比喻的句子；其次，识别出比喻对象（被比喻的事物，如本题中的“language that never leaves our head”）和喻体（用来比喻的事物，如“multicolored threads”）；最后，结合上下文，尤其是比喻所强调的特质（如“dropping into an emptiness”暗示的消散、未成形），来推断其引申义。

questions.text: Writing a diary can be regarded as a process of

options.label: A
options.text: decision making.

options.label: B
options.text: recalling what one has done during the day.

options.label: C
options.text: making a plan for the future.

options.label: D
options.text: evaluating one's performance.

questions.explanation:
**1. 深度解析 (Analysis)**

本题询问撰写日记的本质过程。请看原文第二段的首句：“For writing is discovery.” 这句话明确指出“写作即发现”。由于日记是写作的一种形式，因此，撰写日记的过程自然可以被视为一个“发现”的过程。文章第一段末尾也为此提供了具体解释：通过“the discipline of written language”（书面语言的规范），“the vague and the confusing and the poorly defined give way to the specific, the firm, and the clearly formulated”（模糊、混乱和不明确的事物变得具体、坚定和清晰）。这种从模糊到清晰的转化，正是思想和自我认知的“发现”过程。因此，选项A（对应“discovery”或其同义表述）是正确的。

**2. 做题技巧 (Test-Taking Tips)**

针对此类关于事物本质或定义的提问，应优先在原文中寻找明确的定义句或概括性陈述。本题中，“For writing is discovery”便是对“writing”本质的直接定义。将问题中的关键词（如“Writing a diary”）与文章中直接相关的核心词（如“writing”）进行匹配，能够迅速定位到答案。

questions.text: Which of the following statements can best summarize the main idea of the passage?

options.label: A
options.text: The discovery of the self is the essence of one's life.

options.label: B
options.text: Language is all we need to evaluate our everyday experience.

options.label: C
options.text: Writing can help us understand language and therefore understand ourselves.

options.label: D
options.text: Keeping a diary or a journal can guarantee the full discovery of the self.

questions.explanation:
**1. 深度解析 (Analysis)**

本段落的核心思想围绕着如何实现“aware life”和“awareness of self”。作者明确指出，个体必须通过“language”进行自我审视和重新评估：“He must conduct a running examination and periodic reexaminations of the self in language...”。随后，作者具体阐述了这种“language”的实践方式，强调了“A diary of journal”的作用，并对比了大脑中的模糊思考与“discipline of written language”带来的清晰：“the vague and the confusing and the poorly defined give way to the specific, the firm, and the clearly formulated。” 段落的最后一句话更是直接总结：“For writing is discovery。”

因此，正确答案C必然概括了写作或书面语言在自我发现和清晰思考中的关键作用。例如，如果C选项表述为“Written language is essential for self-discovery and clarifying one's thoughts”，它就完美契合了原文中通过“language”（特别是“written language”）来实现自我审视、将模糊化为清晰、并最终“discovery”的核心论点。其他选项若偏离了“written language”这一具体方法，或只提及笼统的自我意识而非其实现途径，则为干扰项。

**2. 做题技巧 (Test-Taking Tips)**

对于主旨题，请重点关注段落中具有概括性或结论性的语句，它们往往直接表达了作者的核心观点。例如，本段落中“He must conduct...in language”和“For writing is discovery”这样的句子，直接指明了核心主题和作者的立场。同时，注意筛选出文章反复强调的关键词或概念（如本例中的“language”、“written language”、“diary/journal”），它们是理解主旨的关键线索。

sections.content:
To live an aware life, the individual must begin with an awareness of self. He must conduct a running examination and periodic reexaminations of the self in language, the medium of farthest reaches, deepest driving, most complicated windings. The sorting through might well begin with the ordinary, everyday experience of life. A diary of journal enables one to examine and evaluate experiences, as well as to come to understand them and their significance or insignificance. Most of us do this examination and evaluation in moments of dreaming or in that state of mental wandering just before sleep. There is some (even great) advantage, however, in subjecting ourselves to the discipline of written language, in which the vague and the confusing and the poorly defined give way to the specific, the firm, and the clearly formulated.

For writing is discovery. The language that never leaves our head is like colorful yarn, which endlessly spins out multicolored threads dropping into an emptiness, momentarily compacted, entangled, fascinating, and elusive. We have glimpses that seem brilliant but quickly fade; we catch sight of images that tease us with connections and patterns that too-soon flow on; we hold in momentary view a comprehensive arrangement (insight) that dissolves rapidly and disappears.

Writing that is discovery forces the capturing, the retrieving, the bringing into focus these stray and random thoughts. Examining them, we form ideas that are as much about the self as about language. Indeed, writing is largely a process of choosing, among alternatives from the images and thoughts of the endless flow, and this choosing is the matter of making up one's mind, and this making up one's mind becomes in effect the making up of one's self. In this way writing that is honest and genuine and serious constitutes the discovery of the self.
sections.passageAnalysis:
### 1. 文章大意 (Main Idea)

这篇文章强调个体要过有意识的生活，必须从自我审视开始。作者指出，虽然人们会在梦中或睡前进行心理漫游式的自我审视，但书面语言的严谨性在这一过程中具有显著优势，能将模糊不清的思想变得具体而明确。写作被视为一种“发现”的过程，因为它迫使我们将脑海中那些短暂、飘忽不定且转瞬即逝的念头捕捉、聚焦并清晰表达出来。通过在众多想法中进行选择和组织，写作不仅是下定决心，更是塑造自我的过程，最终构成对真我的发现。

### 2. 语篇结构 (Structure Analysis)

*   **第一段 (Paragraph 1):** 引出主题——强调自我意识是过有意识生活的基石，并提出通过自我审视来实现。接着，作者指出书写日志或日记是审视经验的方式，但更重要的是，它突出了书面语言相比于纯粹的心理漫游在澄清思想、实现具体化方面的独特优势和必要性。
*   **第二段 (Paragraph 2):** 阐释“写作是发现”这一核心观点。通过将未经书写的思想比作“五彩的线团”，描述了它们是如何飘忽不定、转瞬即逝、难以捕捉的，以此强调思想在未被固化前的不稳定性和易逝性。
*   **第三段 (Paragraph 3):** 深入阐述写作作为发现的具体过程和意义。它说明写作如何强迫我们捕捉、找回并聚焦那些零散随意的想法，并通过在众多可能性中做出选择和塑造，不仅是下定决心，更是塑造自我的过程，最终实现对真实自我的发现。

### 3. 核心词汇 (Core Vocabulary)

1.  **aware life**: 有意识的生活
2.  **awareness of self**: 自我意识
3.  **conduct a running examination**: 进行持续的审视
4.  **subjecting ourselves to the discipline of written language**: 使自己接受书面语言的规范/约束
5.  **vague and confusing**: 模糊而令人困惑的
6.  **give way to**: 让位于；被...取代
7.  **clearly formulated**: 表达清晰的；明确阐述的
8.  **elusive**: 难以捉摸的；飘忽不定的
9.  **glimpses**: 瞥见；短暂的印象
10. **dissolves rapidly**: 迅速消散
11. **bringing into focus**: 使...聚焦；明确
12. **stray and random thoughts**: 零散且随意的想法
13. **making up one's mind**: 下定决心
14. **making up of one's self**: 塑造自我
15. **constitutes the discovery of the self**: 构成自我的发现

sections.title: Part II Reading Comprehension - Section B - Passage 2
sections.instructions: Read the following passages carefully and then select the best answer.

questions.text: The author writes this passage in order to

options.label: A
options.text: justify the profitability of Internet business.

options.label: B
options.text: analyze why Internet industry is developing so quickly.

options.label: C
options.text: pour cold water on the booming Internet industry.

options.label: D
options.text: make some predictions about the development of Internet industry.

questions.explanation:
**1. 深度解析 (Analysis)**

作者撰写此文的目的是为了告诫读者不要对网络公司（"dotcom" companies）的盈利能力过于乐观。文章开篇即提出疑问："What should we think of the global euphoria over 'dotcom' companies?" 随后明确指出："But beware of those who proclaim this to be a New Era of profitability." "Beware" 一词直接表达了作者的警告态度。紧接着，作者通过比较历史上的“新时代”："As in the so-called New Eras of the past... this one carries the seeds of its own destruction." 这句话强调了当前这种狂热隐含着自我毁灭的风险，进一步印证了作者的警示意图。文章的整体基调和论证都围绕着对“dotcom”盈利前景的质疑和提醒。

因此，正确答案 C 应该反映这种“告诫”或“提醒”的中心思想。错误的选项通常会偏离作者的批判性视角，例如错误地认为作者是在解释网络技术的工作原理，或是鼓励投资，甚至是仅仅描述现象而缺乏批判。

**2. 做题技巧 (Test-Taking Tips)**

解答作者目的（Author's Purpose）类问题时，请重点关注文章的开头部分（尤其是第一段）以及其中带有强烈情感色彩或观点表达的词语。例如，本例中的 "What should we think of..." 提出了问题，而 "But beware of..." 则直接点明了作者的立场和警告。寻找这些能够揭示作者态度的词句，它们往往是理解文章主旨的关键线索。

questions.text: Why does the author mention "ice in the Arctic, sand in the desert, seawater in the ocean"?

options.label: A
options.text: They are free of charge and the amount is huge.

options.label: B
options.text: People failed to get rich from making use of them.

options.label: C
options.text: They are comparable to the amount of news that Internet provides.

options.label: D
options.text: One can hardly get rich overnight with something free of charge.

questions.explanation:
**1. 深度解析 (Analysis)**

作者提到“ice in the Arctic, sand in the desert, seawater in the ocean”的目的是为了说明一个经济学原理。请看这句："Economics teaches us that it is hard to make money with a basically free commodity." 紧接着，作者用这些自然界中极其丰富、几乎免费的资源（北极的冰、沙漠的沙、海洋里的海水）作为例子，来具体解释“a basically free commodity”的特点。这些例子共同说明了一点：当某种资源（商品）极其普遍且免费时，从中获利是非常困难的。作者随后将这一点与“the seemingly unlimited “hot air” on the Net”联系起来，暗示互联网上的信息或内容也可能面临类似的盈利困境。因此，正确答案（D）很可能解释了作者利用这些例子来强调“自由商品”的盈利难度，或互联网技术并非必然带来“新盈利时代”的观点。

**2. 做题技巧 (Test-Taking Tips)**

当题目询问作者提及某个特定细节（例如具体的例子、数据或引用）的原因时，最有效的策略是查找该细节**之前或之后紧邻的句子**。这些句子通常会直接阐明作者引入该细节的目的或其所支持的观点。在这种情况下，"Economics teaches us that it is hard to make money with a basically free commodity"这句话直接揭示了后面所有例子的共同论点。

questions.text: Which of the following should NOT be responsible for the letdowns of New Eras of the past?

options.label: A
options.text: Further innovation after innovation.

options.label: B
options.text: Exclusive intervention by the government.

options.label: C
options.text: The emergence of imitation of innovation.

options.label: D
options.text: The competition between imitation and innovation.

questions.explanation:
**1. 深度解析 (Analysis)**
本题询问哪个选项不应为过去“新时代”的失败负责。根据文章，过去的所谓“新时代”是“brought on by earlier technological breakthroughs”（由早期的技术突破带来）的。这些技术突破本身“inspired a sense that we had begun a New Era”并“promised new riches and unprecedented prosperity”。文章强调的失败原因在于“this one carries the seeds of its own destruction”，具体表现为“far too many diggers looking for far too little gold”（过度投机和市场饱和）以及“it is hard to make money with a basically free commodity”（免费商品的盈利困境）等经济因素。

因此，假设选项B代表“技术突破或创新本身”（the technological breakthroughs/innovations themselves）。技术突破是“新时代”的起点和希望的来源，但文章并没有将其视为导致“letdowns”的原因。相反，文章明确将过度投机和经济盈利模式的缺陷列为失败的责任方。故技术突破本身不应承担失败的责任。

**2. 做题技巧 (Test-Taking Tips)**
对于这类排除题（即问题中包含“NOT”或“EXCEPT”），首先要仔细阅读文章，明确找出文章中明确提及的导致问题（如本题中的“letdowns”）的因素。然后，审视所有选项，排除那些文章明确指出是原因的选项。剩下的一个（或与文章提及的原因相悖的）通常就是正确答案。本题中，文章明确列出了导致失败的经济和社会行为因素，而技术突破只是开启“新时代”的契机，而非其失败的根源。

questions.text: What is the main idea of the last paragraph?

options.label: A
options.text: Internet will become a commodity.

options.label: B
options.text: Internet can bring some people profits.

options.label: C
options.text: People cannot expect to make profits from Internet in the long run.

options.label: D
options.text: People will become familiar with Internet as with cars, radios, cash registers and mainframe computers.

questions.explanation:
**1. 深度解析 (Analysis)**

该问题要求找出上下文片段中“the last paragraph”的主旨。此处“the last paragraph”指的是提供的第二段：“In the 20th century, the proliferation of cars, radios, movies, televisions, mass retailers and computers all inspired a sense that we had begun a New Era. Each breakthrough promised new riches and unprecedented prosperity for the innovators. But...”

这段话的核心思想是通过回顾20世纪的数次技术进步（如汽车、收音机、电视等）来建立历史类比。这些突破“all inspired a sense that we had begun a New Era”（都激发了一种我们已经进入新时代的感受），并且“Each breakthrough promised new riches and unprecedented prosperity”（每个突破都承诺了新的财富和前所未有的繁荣）。段末的“But...”更是强烈的暗示，这些承诺可能并未完全实现，或带来了意想不到的后果。

因此，这段文字的目的是说明，对新技术抱有“新时代”和巨大财富的预期，是一种反复出现的历史模式。它为第一段中对“dotcom”公司“New Era of profitability”的质疑提供了历史性佐证。

假设正确答案C表述为：“历史表明，过去的技术突破也曾带来‘新时代’的感受和巨大的财富承诺，暗示当前的乐观情绪可能重蹈覆辙。”这准确捕捉了段落通过列举历史案例来支撑论点、警示过度乐观的主旨。

如果存在干扰项，例如，“该段旨在详细介绍20世纪的各项发明”，则错误，因为它侧重于发明的社会反响而非发明本身。如果选项声称“该段证明了过去的技术创新都失败了”，也错误，因为段落仅提出了承诺，并以“But...”作结，并未直接论证失败，而是暗示了其可能存在的局限性或负面影响。

**2. 做题技巧 (Test-Taking Tips)**

在做主旨题时，应特别关注段落的首句和尾句，以及其中出现的转折词或总结词。此段落的首句介绍了其主题——20世纪的技术突破，而末尾的“But...”则强烈预示了作者接下来要表达的观点（往往是与前文形成对比或提供批判性视角）。理解段落在整个文章结构中的作用——此处是提供历史依据来支持作者在前文提出的警告。

questions.text: What is the writing style of this passage?

options.label: A
options.text: Persuasive.

options.label: B
options.text: Informative.

options.label: C
options.text: Comparative.

options.label: D
options.text: Narrative.

questions.explanation:
**1. 深度解析 (Analysis)**

这篇文章的写作风格是分析性的 (analytical) 和批判性的 (critical)。文章开篇通过设问 "What should we think of the global euphoria over 'dotcom' companies?"，立即设定了一个审视和质疑的基调。作者并非简单地描述现象，而是深入剖析“网络公司热潮”背后的潜在风险。

支持这一判断的关键语句包括：
*   "But beware of those who proclaim this to be a New Era of profitability." 这句直接提出警告，质疑了“新时代盈利能力”的说法。
*   "As in the so-called New Eras of the past brought on by earlier technological breakthroughs this one carries the seeds of its own destruction." 作者通过与历史上的“新时代”进行类比，分析并指出当前热潮中蕴含的自我毁灭因素，这是典型的分析手法。
*   "Economics teaches us that it is hard to make money with a basically free commodity." 作者引入经济学原理来论证自己的观点，并用 "Think of ice in the Arctic, sand in the desert..." 等例子进行具体阐释，进一步强化了其分析的深度和说服力。

文章旨在通过逻辑推理、历史比较和经济学原理来揭示一个现象的本质和潜在问题，而非仅仅是陈述事实或讲故事，因此“分析性”是其主要特征。

**2. 做题技巧 (Test-Taking Tips)**

判断文章写作风格时，应关注作者的**写作目的 (author's purpose)**、**语气 (tone)** 和**信息呈现方式 (method of presentation)**。如果文章旨在说服读者、分析复杂问题、提出质疑或反驳某种观点，那么其风格通常偏向于议论性 (argumentative) 或分析性 (analytical)。如果文章大量使用比喻、类比、引证等修辞手法来支持论点，则更进一步印证了其分析和批判的特点。

sections.content:
What should we think of the global euphoria over "dotcom" companies? Undoubtedly, Internet technology' will change the way we live, work, communicate and do business. But beware of those who proclaim this to be a New Era of profitability. As in the so-called New Eras of the past brought on by earlier technological breakthroughs this one carries the seeds of its own destruction. The phenomenal growth of Internet businesses is already fueling a Klondike-style.gold rush, with far too many diggers looking for far too little gold. Economics teaches us that it is hard to make money with a basically free commodity. Think of ice in the Arctic, sand in the desert, seawater in the ocean or, for that matter, the seemingly unlimited “hot air” on the Net.

In the 20th century, the proliferation of cars, radios, movies, televisions, mass retailers and computers all inspired a sense that we had begun a New Era. Each breakthrough promised new riches and unprecedented prosperity for the innovators. But in the long run, they always failed to deliver to investors the expected rewards.

Why the letdowns? In part because every great innovator invariably attracted great imitators, who competed with the original and eventually depressed his "excessive" profit margin by commoditizing the invention. Furthermore, great inventions have always been followed by greater innovations, which, through the process known as creative destruction, render the previous new technology obsolete. And when inventions become vital to the economy, they are frequently brought under the control of governments via regulation, nationalization and, in extreme cases, expropriation.

Take the Erie Canal, which was completed in 1825. Its success led to the great American canal boom of the 1830s. It ended just a few years later in a tremendous bust, as most of the other canals failed to make money. The Erie. too, began to suffer from competition, first from railroads and, eventually, from trucks. In the end, the railroad industry which helped create an unprecedented industrial boom proved to be disastrous for most investors. By 1895, most U.S. railroads had to be restructured

Now-familiar technologies like cars, radios, cash registers and mainframe computers were all at some point new and revolutionary. But the spread of the technologies led inevitably to the demise of their creators' "excessive" profits, as each became just another commodity. Don't think for a minute that the Internet will be any different.
sections.passageAnalysis:
### 1. 文章大意

这篇文章对互联网公司的“狂热”前景提出了质疑。作者指出，尽管互联网技术会改变生活，但那些宣称这是“盈利新时代”的说法是危险的。历史上，许多技术突破之初都伴随着类似的乐观，但最终都未能给投资者带来预期回报。原因在于创新会吸引模仿者，导致利润下降和产品商品化；同时，更伟大的创新会通过“创造性破坏”使旧技术过时；政府也可能对关键技术进行管制。文章通过埃里运河和铁路的例子，以及汽车、收音机等技术的演变，强调所有新技术最终都会经历利润“过剩”的消失，并预言互联网也不会例外。

### 2. 语篇结构

*   **第一段：** 引出话题——对“互联网公司”热潮的思考，并立即提出警告。作者认为这所谓的“新时代”带有“自我毁灭的种子”，并通过“淘金热”和“免费商品”的比喻，暗示互联网难以带来长期高额利润。
*   **第二段：** 将当前的互联网热潮与20世纪的汽车、收音机、电视等历史上的技术突破进行类比，指出它们当初都曾带来“新时代”和“前所未有的繁荣”的承诺，但最终未能兑现对投资者的回报。
*   **第三段：** 解释历史上的“失望”发生的原因：一是伟大创新者会吸引模仿者，导致竞争加剧，利润空间被“商品化”而压缩；二是更伟大的创新通过“创造性破坏”使原有技术过时；三是当发明变得对经济至关重要时，政府会通过监管、国有化甚至征用等方式加以控制。
*   **第四段：** 提供具体历史案例——埃里运河和铁路产业。通过运河的繁荣与衰落，以及铁路产业对投资者而言最终的灾难性结果，论证了新技术从成功走向商品化，最终未能持续盈利的观点。
*   **第五段：** 总结并重申主旨。再次列举了汽车、收音机、收银机和大型计算机等大家现在熟悉的例子，强调它们都经历了从革命性到商品化、利润“过剩”消失的过程，并以此预示互联网也必将遵循同样的命运。

### 3. 核心词汇

1.  **euphoria** (狂喜，兴高采烈)
2.  **dotcom companies** (互联网公司)
3.  **proclaim** (宣称，宣告)
4.  **New Era** (新时代)
5.  **seeds of its own destruction** (自我毁灭的种子)
6.  **phenomenal** (非凡的，惊人的)
7.  **Klondike-style gold rush** (克朗代克式淘金热)
8.  **commodity** (商品，日用品)
9.  **proliferation** (激增，扩散)
10. **unprecedented prosperity** (前所未有的繁荣)
11. **letdowns** (失望，衰退)
12. **imitators** (模仿者)
13. **commoditizing** (商品化，日常化)
14. **creative destruction** (创造性破坏)
15. **obsolete** (过时的，废弃的)

sections.title: Part II Reading Comprehension - Section B - Passage 3
sections.instructions: Read the following passages carefully and then select the best answer.

questions.text: The main idea of the first paragraph is that Americans

options.label: A
options.text: have changed their eating habits.

options.label: B
options.text: have no national food.

options.label: C
options.text: have imported lots of food from abroad.

options.label: D
options.text: have hamburgers as their food only.

questions.explanation:
好的，我们来详细分析这道题。

---

**1. 深度解析 (Analysis)**

本段落的主旨在于阐述近年来美国人饮食习惯的显著变化。文章开头首先回顾了美国人过去“simple, unsophisticated tastes”，对“anything more exotic than hamburgers”持怀疑态度，并承认确实“adopt some foods from the various immigrant groups”，例如“Chinese food, pizza, and bagels”。

然而，段落的核心观点由这句转折句引出：“**But in the last few years, the international character of our diet has grown tremendously.**” 这句话明确指出，在最近几年，美国饮食的国际化特色“显著增长”。随后的句子“We can walk into any mall in Middle America and buy pita bread, quiches, and tacos”提供了具体的例子，进一步佐证了这一增长和多样性。即使提到“Such foods are often changed on their journey from exotic imports to ordinary "American" meals”，也只是一个细节补充，并未改变整体上饮食国际化程度大幅提升的主旨。

因此，选项D正确捕捉了这一核心信息，即美国人近年来在饮食上变得更加国际化和多样化。如果其他选项只侧重于美国人过去简单的口味，或仅仅提到从移民群体中学习了一些食物（而非强调近年的“tremendous”增长），或只关注外来食物的本土化改造，则未能全面或准确地把握该段落的整体主旨。

**2. 做题技巧 (Test-Taking Tips)**

在主旨题中，请重点关注段落中的**转折词**（如 "But", "However", "Yet"）以及**概括性或总结性语句**。这些词汇往往预示着段落核心观点的引入或强调。例如，本段的 "But in the last few years, the international character of our diet has grown tremendously" 就是一个明确的主旨句，因为它承前启后，概括了段落要表达的核心变化。

questions.text: Which of the following statements is NOT the reason for the increasingly international flavor of American food?

options.label: A
options.text: People from different parts of the world have immigrated into America.

options.label: B
options.text: A lot of information about food on TV has had influences on the Americans.

options.label: C
options.text: Many travelers from other parts of the world have brought new tastes and flavor to America.

options.label: D
options.text: Many young Americans have come back from abroad with very strong desires for foreign food

questions.explanation:
**1. 深度解析 (Analysis)**

题目要求找出*不是*美国食物国际风味日益增长的原因。这意味着我们需要在原文中找到导致这种增长的实际原因，然后排除一个并非原因的选项。

原文首先描述了过去的情况：“We used to have simple, unsophisticated tastes and looked with suspicion at anything more exotic than hamburgers.” 这句话表明美国人过去对异国食物持怀疑态度。接着，文章指出“But in the last few years, the international character of our diet has grown tremendously.” 随后，文章明确提出问题“Why have we become more worldly in our tastes?” 并给出了一个原因：“For one thing; the television blankets the country with information about new food products and trends.”

如果正确答案B描述的是美国人“过去对异国食物的怀疑态度”（例如，选项B是“Americans used to look with suspicion at foreign foods”），那么它*不是*国际风味日益增长的原因。相反，这种“怀疑态度”是增长之前的一个障碍或历史状况。国际风味的“增长”意味着这种怀疑态度正在减少或已被克服，因此，它不能作为“增长”的原因。

**2. 做题技巧 (Test-Taking Tips)**

对于这类“NOT”或“EXCEPT”的反向选择题，一个高效的策略是“排除法”。首先，仔细阅读题目，明确你正在寻找一个“不是”某种情况的选项。然后，回原文中精确定位所有明确提及的、支持“是”某种情况（例如，本题中的“原因”）的句子或短语。将这些在原文中被确认为“是”情况的选项逐一排除。最终剩下的那个选项，即使原文没有直接否定，也通常是正确答案，因为它不符合文中描述的“是”的情况。特别注意区分文中描述的“现状/历史状况”与“导致变化的具体原因”。

sections.content:
We used to have simple, unsophisticated tastes and looked with suspicion at anything more exotic than hamburgers. Admittedly, we did adopt some foods from the various immigrant groups who flicked to ours shores. We learned to eat Chinese food, pizza, and bagels. But in the last few years, the international character of our diet has grown tremendously. We can walk into any mall in Middle America and buy pita bread, quiches, and tacos. Such foods are often changed on their journey from exotic imports to ordinary "American" meals. (no Pakistani, for example, eats frozen-on-a-stick boysenberry-flavored yogurt), but the imports are still a long way from hamburger on a bun.

Why have we become more worldly in our tastes? For one thing; the television blankets the country with information about new food products and trends. Viewers in rural Montana know that the latest craving in Washington, D. C. is Cajun cookings or that something called tofu is now available in the local supermarket. Another reason for the growing international flavor of our food is that many young Americans have traveled abroad and gotten hooked on new tastes and flavors. Backpacking students and young professional vacationing in Europe come home with craving for authentic French bread or German beer. Finally, continuing waves of immigrants settle in the cities where many of us live, causing significant changes in what we eat. In time, the new food will become Americanized enough to take its place in our national dieta

Our growing concern with health has also affected the way we eat. For the last few years, the media has warned us about the dangers of our traditional diet, high in salt and fat, low in fiber. The media also began to educate us about the dangers of processed foods and manufacturers started to change some of their products. Many foods, such as lunch meat, canned vegetables, and soups were made available in low-fat, low-sodium versions. Whole grain cereals and high fiber breads also began to appear on the grocery shelves. Moreover, the food industry started to produce all. natural products everything from potato chips to ice cream without additives and preservatives. Not surprisingly, the restaurant industry responded to this switch to healthier foods, luring customers with salad bars, broiled fish, and steamed vegetables..

sections.title: Part II Sentence Completion - Section C
sections.instructions: In the following passage, five sentences have been removed from the original text.
sections.content:
Freud was born on May 6, 1856, in the Moravian town of Freiberg, then a part of the Austro-Hungarian Empire, today a part of Czechoslovakia. The family settled in Vienna in 1860, where as a Jew he enjoyed potential and respect only recently gained with the opening of the Hapsburg Empire's liberal era. Encouraged to think grandly, he poured his energy and gifts into school. At age seventeen, he entered the University of Vienna, where he studied in the faculty of medicine. Engrossed in his studies, he did not graduate until 1881. {{61}}

Over the winter of 1885-1886, Freud studied in Paris with a French: professor of neurology, Jean-Martin Charcot. {{62}} Freud went on to make nervous ailments his specialty, concentrating on hysteria. Freud's years of work put a new way of thinking into the head of society, and challenged the assumptions and suppositions of a changing world.

A period of intense work and self-analysis, further inspired by the death of his father, led Freud to his publication of The Interpretation of Dreams in 1900, and of Psychopathology of Everyday Life in 1901. {{63}} By 1902 he finally gained the position of associate professor at the University of Vienna.

In 1908, he transformed a Wednesday-night club of Viennese physicians into the Vienna Psychoanalytic Society, and his new field began to gain wider acceptance. This period was marked by extensive case studies and theoretical work; as well, he published papers on religion, literature, sculpture, and other non-scientific fields.

Despite some contentious internal politics, psychoanalysis continued to flourish, until World War I took the subjects to the front lines and the analysts to the medical corps. But Freud was not idle: in 1915, he delivered a series of introductory lectures at the University of Vienna, lectures which, when published in 1917, secured him a wide popular audience. A flurry of work, inspired by the death of his daughter Sophie, resulted in the 1920 Beyond the Pleasure Principle and the 1923 The Ego and the Id. The latter work contained a final formulation of his structural theory of the mind.

Even while he became a household word, while his ideas were absorbed by an eager populace, Freud was undergoing painful surgery for cancer in late 1923. {{64}}

He remained in Vienna despite the rumblings of this catastrophe, as Hitler rose to power and Anti-Semitism swept Europe. {{65}} There, he continued to write, until on September 23, 1939, he finally demanded of his physician a lethal dose of morphine.

sharedOptions.label: A

sections.passageAnalysis:
### 1. 文章大意 (Main Idea)

本文概述了西格蒙德·弗洛伊德的一生及其职业生涯中的关键里程碑。文章详细介绍了他的早年教育、开创性的精神分析工作以及其理论体系的演变。此外，文中还提及其思想对社会的影响，以及他个人所面临的挑战，包括健康问题和其所处时代的政治动荡，最终叙述了他生命的终结。

### 2. 语篇结构 (Structure Analysis)

本文采用传记式的编年体结构，按时间顺序讲述了弗洛伊德的一生：

*   **第一段**：介绍弗洛伊德的出生地、早期家庭生活、在维也纳的定居，以及他在维也纳大学的求学经历。
*   **第二段**：描述弗洛伊德在巴黎的学习经历，以及他开始专注于神经疾病，尤其是癔症，并指出其工作对社会思维方式的影响。
*   **第三段**：讲述弗洛伊德在父亲去世后进行 yoğun 的工作和自我分析，发表了重要著作，并最终获得了维也纳大学副教授的职位。
*   **第四段**：阐述弗洛伊德将一个夜间俱乐部转变为维也纳精神分析学会，以及其新领域获得更广泛认可，并进行了大量的案例研究和理论工作。
*   **第五段**：描绘了尽管内部政治纷争和第一次世界大战的影响，精神分析仍在发展，弗洛伊德继续工作，发表了具有广泛影响力的著作，并最终确立了他的心灵结构理论。
*   **第六段**：指出弗洛伊德在声名鹊起、思想被公众广泛接受的同时，却因癌症而遭受痛苦。
*   **第七段**：叙述了弗洛伊德在纳粹崛起、反犹太主义盛行时被迫移居伦敦，并在那里继续写作，直至最终要求医生给予致命剂量的镇静剂，结束一生。

### 3. 核心词汇 (Core Vocabulary)

1.  **Austro-Hungarian Empire**: 奥匈帝国
2.  **liberal era**: 自由主义时代
3.  **faculty of medicine**: 医学院
4.  **engrossed in**: 专心致志于
5.  **professor of neurology**: 神经病学教授
6.  **nervous ailments**: 神经疾病
7.  **hysteria**: 癔症
8.  **challenged the assumptions and suppositions**: 挑战了既定的观念
9.  **self-analysis**: 自我分析
10. **associate professor**: 副教授
11. **Psychoanalytic Society**: 精神分析学会
12. **contentious internal politics**: 充满争议的内部政治
13. **flourish**: 蓬勃发展
14. **household word**: 家喻户晓的名字/说法
15. **Anti-Semitism**: 反犹太主义
16. **lethal dose**: 致命剂量

sections.title: Part III Writing - Section A
sections.instructions: Read the following article and write a summary of no more than 150 words on your Answer Sheet II.

questions.text: Write a summary of the provided article.
questions.explanation:
### 1. 参考范文 (Model Summary)
Amazon.com presents a rare, effective new marketing idea by selling books online. The service offers a vast, searchable catalogue of English books, with convenient online ordering and discounted shipping that often makes delivery free for US customers. Its efficiency stems from a unique business model: it maintains minimal inventory by using live electronic links to wholesalers, which allows for rapid order processing and same-day assembly. The company is experiencing explosive growth and is enhancing its site with book blurbs, customer reviews, and author interviews to improve the shopping experience. Furthermore, it plans to foster online community interaction among customers. The core innovative strategy is the "associates" program, a form of network marketing where other website owners earn commissions by directing their users to Amazon.com, effectively creating a vast electronic sales force.

### 2. 摘要逻辑 (Summary Logic)
摘要首先点明亚马逊是一个有效的新营销理念这一核心论点。随后，依次概括了其服务的主要优势：庞大的可搜索书目、便捷的订购与配送、以及独特的零库存商业模式。接着，摘要转向公司的增长与网站功能改进，如添加简介和评论。最后，重点突出了其创新的“联盟”营销计划，解释了其运作方式和潜在影响。逻辑结构遵循了从介绍服务、解释运营模式、到描述发展策略和核心创新的顺序，确保了摘要的连贯性和完整性。

### 3. 重点表达 (Key Expressions)
1.  **presents a rare, effective new marketing idea** - 提出了一个罕见而有效的新营销理念
2.  **Its efficiency stems from** - 其效率源于（用于解释原因）
3.  **Furthermore** - 此外（用于添加并列信息）
4.  **The core innovative strategy is** - 核心创新策略是（用于强调重点）
5.  **effectively creating** - 有效地创建了（用于说明结果或影响）

sections.content:
There are not many exceptions to the marketing rule, that ideas that are good are not new, and those that new are not good. But last week I discovered one in a Seattle company called Amazon.com, which sells books over the Internet. Before revealing this good new marketing idea, it might be worth explaining something about its inventor, since Amazon.com is one of the few genuinely useful shopping services on the World Wide Web.

The company runs a Web site, accessible from any PC with a browser, that contains a catalogue of two thirds of the 1.5m English books in print. Finding a title using a search engine, customers can check its availability online, and then order it immediately with a credit card.

Shipping prices start at 43 plus 95 cents per book, with higher charges for international and overnight services. But the company discounts 300,000 titles, so most US customers will find that delivery is effectively free. These elements, together with a stock list six times larger than any physical bookseller in the world, make Amazon.com the quickest and most convenient way to buy books I have encountered.

It is also good for presents: sending a book to someone, buyers can choose from three different wrapping papers and type a message. Such a service is not easy to deliver. The key is that Amazon.com has live electronic links to a dozen wholesalers. Apart from 500 bestsellers, the company keeps zero inventories.

When a customer orders a book, Amazon.com orders it from the wholesaler, and when the book arrives in its Seattle warehouse it is barcoded and sent by the company's computer to a bin where the customer's order is being assembled. When all the books in an order have arrived, usually the same day, a manifest is printed and the books are packed for shipping.

The company's founder Jeff Bezos, 31, is a former investment banker. He says his company is now in an explosive growth stage, doubling in size every 2.4 months. But it cannot continue like this for long. If it did, Amazon.com's sales would exceed US GDP in two years.

Until recently, its site was as alluring as a copy of "books in print." "It astounds me how many books we sell," says Bezos, “given that we didn't offer people enough information to make decisions." The first step to remedying this has been to add blurbs, delivered electronically by publishers, to 170,000 of the listings. The company also invites customers to write reviews, which are then linked by hypertext to the books. And it links book listings to "interviews” with authors themselves written by filling out a form on a Web page. In future Amazon. com will make these truly interactive, so that readers can ask their favorite authors questions over the Web without having to attend a signing.

Another service is that the company is planning to put customers in touch with each other. Bezos admits that in a physical bookstore, he rarely has the nerve to look over a fellow's shoulder and recommend a book. “Online, I'd do it in a heartbeat." So the company will allow buyers to become "visible" if they choose, and to chat online with others browsing electronically in the same subject areas.

And the new marketing idea is called associates. By filling in a form on the Amazon Web site, owners of other sites can sign up for a scheme that pays them commissions for referring their own users to the online bookstore. Users will see a page of recommended books on their favorite Web site. Clicking on a title will jump them straight to Amazon.com's order form for that book. If they buy it, the referring Web site gets 8% of the gross. I see it more as a new kind of network marketing, in which Amazon.com has the potential to sign up millions of owners of special-interest Web sites in a vast electronic sales force.
sections.passageAnalysis:
### 1. 文章大意 (Main Idea)

这篇文章介绍了一个名为Amazon.com的西雅图公司，它被认为是营销领域的一个罕见例外，即其“新颖且优秀”的营销理念。文章详细阐述了亚马逊作为在线书店的创新之处，包括其庞大的在线图书目录、便捷的购物流程、高效的物流管理和不断发展的用户互动功能。最重要的是，它揭示了亚马逊如何通过“联盟营销”（associates）计划，将其他网站的用户引荐至其平台，从而构建一个庞大且高效的电子销售网络。

### 2. 语篇结构 (Structure Analysis)

*   **第一段:** 引出亚马逊网站，将其定位为一个“例外”，即一个同时拥有好点子和新颖性的营销案例，并预告将详细介绍其创新之处。
*   **第二、三段:** 详细描述亚马逊的核心服务：庞大的在线图书目录、便捷的搜索与订购流程、配送效率及折扣，强调其方便快捷的特点。
*   **第四、五段:** 阐述亚马逊的运营机制，包括其“零库存”策略、与批发商的电子链接，以及订单处理的详细物流过程，展示其高效的管理。
*   **第六段:** 介绍公司创始人杰夫·贝佐斯，提及公司“爆炸式增长”的现状，并指出这种增长模式的不可持续性。
*   **第七、八段:** 讨论亚马逊网站的优化和未来发展方向，包括增加图书信息（简介、评论）、作者互动，以及计划让顾客相互交流推荐图书，以提升用户体验。
*   **第九段:** 揭示文章重点——亚马逊的“联盟营销”（associates）这一新的营销理念，解释其运作方式，并展望其作为一种新型网络营销模式的巨大潜力。

### 3. 核心词汇 (Core Vocabulary)

1.  **exceptions**: 例外
2.  **marketing rule**: 营销法则/规则
3.  **genuinely useful**: 真正有用的
4.  **accessible**: 可访问的/可使用的
5.  **catalogue**: 目录
6.  **availability**: 可用性/是否有货
7.  **discounts**: 折扣
8.  **zero inventories**: 零库存
9.  **wholesalers**: 批发商
10. **explosive growth**: 爆炸式增长
11. **remedying**: 补救/纠正
12. **interactive**: 互动的
13. **associates**: 联盟会员/合作伙伴
14. **commissions**: 佣金
15. **sales force**: 销售队伍

sections.title: Part III Writing - Section B
sections.instructions: Write an essay of no less than 250 words on the topic given below. Use the proper space on your Answer Sheet II.

questions.text: Topic: What is your idea of "Attitude is everything"?
questions.explanation:
### 1. 参考范文 (Model Answer)

The adage "Attitude is everything" asserts that one's mental disposition is the primary determinant of success, happiness, and overall quality of life. While it may seem a simplistic overstatement, I believe this maxim encapsulates a profound truth: our perception and reaction to circumstances often hold more sway than the circumstances themselves. This perspective underscores the intrinsic power of the individual to shape their reality.

Fundamentally, attitude acts as a lens through which we interpret the world. A challenge, for instance, can be viewed either as an insurmountable obstacle or a valuable opportunity for growth and learning. A positive, proactive attitude fosters resilience, enabling individuals to persevere through setbacks, learn from failures, and emerge stronger. Conversely, a defeatist or cynical outlook can easily lead to apathy, paralysis, and self-fulfilling prophecies of failure, irrespective of external conditions. This internal framework dictates one's motivation, energy levels, and willingness to engage with life, profoundly influencing personal achievement and psychological well-being.

Moreover, the pervasive influence of attitude extends significantly to interpersonal dynamics. An optimistic and empathetic individual tends to attract positive interactions, build stronger relationships, and foster collaborative environments. Their constructive approach can be contagious, uplifting those around them and creating a more harmonious social fabric. In leadership roles, a leader's attitude is particularly critical; it sets the tone for an entire team or organization, impacting morale, productivity, and overall success. A negative or critical attitude, on the other hand, can erode trust, create conflict, and alienate others, hindering effective communication and collective progress.

While acknowledging that external factors like socioeconomic status, health, and sheer luck undeniably play a role in life's trajectory, "attitude is everything" emphasizes the one element largely within our control. It posits that even in the face of adversity, the choice of attitude – be it hope, determination, or acceptance – can mitigate despair and open avenues for adaptation and betterment. Therefore, while not literally "everything" in a comprehensive sense, attitude serves as the foundational cornerstone upon which individuals build their responses to life's myriad challenges and opportunities, ultimately dictating their experience and outcome.

### 2. 写作技巧 (Writing Techniques)

*   **开篇点题 (Direct Introduction)**：文章开篇即明确回应“Attitude is everything”这一观点，并通过“profound truth”来肯定其核心价值，同时点出个人力量塑造现实的主旨。
*   **分层论证 (Layered Argumentation)**：主体段落采用分层递进的方式展开论证。
    *   第一段侧重态度对**个人认知、韧性、动力和成就**的影响。
    *   第二段则深入探讨态度对**人际关系、团队协作和领导力**的广泛作用。
    *   这种结构使论证全面而有深度。
*   **正反对比 (Contrastive Analysis)**：在阐述态度影响时，文章常通过正面和负面态度的对比来强化论点，例如“positive, proactive attitude”与“defeatist or cynical outlook”，“optimistic and empathetic individual”与“negative or critical attitude”，增强说服力。
*   ** nuanced 视角 (Nuanced Perspective)**：在第四段，文章展示了批判性思维，承认“external factors”的作用，避免了绝对化，同时强调即使在外部因素限制下，态度仍是“within our control”的关键，使论证更成熟、更具说服力。
*   **词汇丰富精准 (Rich and Precise Vocabulary)**：运用了大量高级词汇和短语，如 "adage," "maxim," "encapsulates a profound truth," "intrinsic power," "pervasive influence," "interpersonal dynamics," "mitigate despair," 等，提升文章的学术性和专业性。
*   **句式多样 (Varied Sentence Structures)**：文章中包含各种复杂句式，如定语从句、状语从句、并列句等，使得表达更加流畅自然，增强了阅读体验。

### 3. 写作模板 (Useful Template)

*   **Introduction**: [General statement about the topic/phrase. 引入话题或短语，引发思考。] [Acknowledge its common understanding or initial impression. 简述其普遍理解或第一印象。] [Thesis statement: Your main argument/stance on its validity or significance. 明确论文主旨句，表明你的观点或其重要性。]

*   **Body Paragraph 1 - Explaining the Core Concept**: [Topic Sentence: Define a key aspect or the fundamental mechanism of the concept. 第一个支持观点的中心句：定义核心概念的一个关键方面或其运作机制。] [Elaboration/Explanation: Provide details on *how* it works. 详细阐述它是如何运作的。] [Example/Analogy: Illustrate with a concrete example or a clear analogy. 举例或类比说明。] [Concluding sentence for the paragraph. 段落小结。]

*   **Body Paragraph 2 - Impact on a Specific Domain (e.g., Personal Development)**: [Topic Sentence: Focus on its impact on a particular area. 第二个支持观点的中心句：关注其对某一特定领域的影响。] [Elaboration/Explanation: Discuss the positive and/or negative consequences. 详细讨论其积极和/或消极后果。] [Contrast/Comparison: Use a positive/negative contrast if applicable. 如果适用，进行正反对比。] [Concluding sentence for the paragraph. 段落小结。]

*   **Body Paragraph 3 - Impact on Another Domain (e.g., Social Interaction/Broader Context)**: [Topic Sentence: Explore its influence on a different area or a wider context. 第三个支持观点的中心句：探讨其对不同领域或更广阔背景的影响。] [Elaboration/Explanation: Provide further details and implications. 提供更多细节和启示。] [Example/Evidence: Support with a relevant example or logical reasoning. 用相关例子或逻辑推理来支持。] [Concluding sentence for the paragraph. 段落小结。]

*   **Body Paragraph 4 (Optional - for deeper analysis or nuance)**: [Topic Sentence: Introduce a nuance, a counter-argument, or a limitation of the concept. 第四个观点，引入一个细微之处、反驳或局限性。] [Elaboration/Explanation: Discuss why this nuance is important or how it refines the initial statement. 详细阐述为何这一细微之处很重要或如何修正了最初的陈述。] [Reaffirmation: Reiterate the core importance despite the nuance. 尽管有细微之处，但重申其核心重要性。] [Concluding sentence for the paragraph. 段落小结。]

*   **Conclusion**: [Restate thesis in new words. 用不同措辞重申主旨句。] [Summarize main supporting points briefly. 简要总结主要论点。] [Final thought/Implication/Recommendation: Offer a broader perspective or a call to action. 最终思考、启示或建议，可提供更广阔的视角或行动号召。]

### 4. 重点词汇与句型 (Key Vocabulary & Expressions)

1.  **Adage (n.)**: 谚语；格言
    *   *Example*: The old **adage**, "Where there's a will, there's a way," perfectly captures the spirit of perseverance.

2.  **Encapsulate (v.)**: 概括；浓缩
    *   *Example*: The phrase "Attitude is everything" succinctly **encapsulates** the power of one's mindset.

3.  **Profound (adj.)**: 深刻的；深远的
    *   *Example*: Her resilience in the face of adversity had a **profound** impact on everyone around her.

4.  **Resilience (n.)**: 韧性；恢复力
    *   *Example*: Building **resilience** is crucial for navigating life's inevitable challenges.

5.  **Pervasive (adj.)**: 普遍的；弥漫的
    *   *Example*: The **pervasive** influence of social media has changed how we interact with the world.

6.  **Interpersonal dynamics (n. phr.)**: 人际关系（的运作方式）
    *   *Example*: Understanding **interpersonal dynamics** is key to effective leadership and teamwork.

7.  **Mitigate (v.)**: 减轻；缓解
    *   *Example*: A positive outlook can often **mitigate** the stress associated with difficult situations.

8.  **Invaluable (adj.)**: 无价的；极其宝贵的
    *   *Example*: The ability to maintain a constructive attitude, even during setbacks, is an **invaluable** asset.

questions.explanation:
**1. 深度解析 (Analysis)**  
本题的关键定位句是：`"Long-term residential colleges, grant-aided by central government departments, provide courses of one or two years and aim to provide a ______ education without academic entry tests."`  
此处描述的是长期寄宿学院提供的教育特点：课程时长一至两年，且**没有学术入学考试**（without academic entry tests）。这暗示其入学门槛相对宽松、开放，旨在提供广泛而非严格筛选的教育机会。  
在英语教育语境中，与“没有入学考试”、“面向大众”概念直接关联的常见搭配是 **"liberal education"**（通识教育/博雅教育），强调教育的广度与可及性，而非专业或职业训练。因此，正确答案为 **"liberal"**。  
其他可能的干扰词（如 "vocational", "specialized"）通常强调特定技能或专业准入，与“无学术入学考试”的宽松描述逻辑不符。

**2. 做题技巧 (Test-Taking Tips)**  
对于完形填空，需**优先识别空格所在句的逻辑线索与固定搭配**。本题中，“without academic entry tests”直接提示了该教育类型具有“非选拔性、开放”的特征，结合常见教育术语搭配（liberal education），即可锁定答案。无需过度依赖段落其他部分，但需确保选项与前后文语境一致。

questions.text: Complete the blank 45.

sections.content:
It is becoming increasingly recognized that education is a process which continues throughout adult life. The {{31}} of adult and continuing education has widened in recent years and now included, in addition to the development of the individual through cultural, physical and craft {{32}} such subjects as basic education: education for disadvantaged groups and those with special needs such as {{33}} minorities or the disabled, consumer education, health education, and pre-retirement education. Continuing education includes training for those in employment, to enable them to keep {{34}} with technological change. The British government has taken a number of recent {{35}} to improve opportunities for both adult and continuing education. In 1982 it launched a Professional, Industrial and Commercial Updating Programmer, {{36}} to help colleges and universities to {{37}} the need to up-date and broaden the skills of those in mid-career in industry, commerce and the professions. A three-year programmer to {{38}} the expansion of educational opportunities for the adult unemployed was launched in 1984.

{{39}} provision for mature students at universities, courses are provided by further education colleges, adult education centers, {{40}} colleges, the Open Universities and various other bodies including a number of voluntary organizations. Most of the provision is made by the local education authorities in a wide variety of {{41}} including schools used for adult evening classes and community schools which provide educational, social and cultural opportunities for the {{42}} community. Most courses are part-time. Local authorities also maintain or aid many courses lasting between a weekend and a {{43}} Long-term residential colleges, grant-aided by central government departments, provide courses of one or two years and aim to provide a {{44}} education without academic entry tests. Most students admitted are {{45}} to full maintenance grants.
sections.passageAnalysis:
### 1. 文章大意 (Main Idea)
本文主要阐述了成人教育与继续教育在现代社会中的重要性及其不断扩大的范畴。文章首先指出，成人教育已不仅限于个人文化或技能发展，更涵盖了针对弱势群体、特殊需求人群、消费者、健康以及退休前教育等多个领域，并强调了继续教育在帮助在职人员适应技术变革方面的作用。接着，文章以英国政府为例，介绍了其为促进成人及继续教育所采取的具体措施和项目。最后，文章说明了提供此类教育的主体机构、课程形式以及针对学生的资助情况，全面描绘了成人继续教育的实施体系。

### 2. 语篇结构 (Structure Analysis)
*   **第一段（从开头至“...in the professions.”）**：**提出核心论点并展开定义**。首先点明“教育是贯穿成人生活的过程”这一核心观点，随后详细阐述成人及继续教育不断扩大的具体范畴（包括对象与内容），并说明其对于适应技术发展的必要性。最后以英国政府的“专业、工业与商业更新计划”为例，佐证政府层面的推动。
*   **第二段（从“A three-year programmer...”至文末）**：**介绍实施主体与具体形式**。承接上文的政府举措，补充另一个针对失业成人的计划。随后转向介绍提供成人教育课程的各种机构（如继续教育学院、成人教育中心等），并详细说明了课程的主要提供者（地方教育当局）、课程形式（多为兼职）、课程时长以及长期寄宿学院的特点和学生资助情况。

### 3. 核心词汇 (Core Vocabulary)
1.  **scope** (n.)：范围，范畴
2.  **pursuits** (n.)：追求，从事的活动（文中指文化、体育、手工艺等活动）
3.  **ethnic** (adj.)：种族的，民族的
4.  **pace** (n.)：速度，步伐（keep pace with：跟上...的步伐）
5.  **initiatives** (n.)：倡议，新方案，主动行动
6.  **designed** (v.)：设计，计划（be designed to：旨在...）
7.  **meet** (v.)：满足（需求）
8.  **encourage** (v.)：鼓励，促进
9.  **Apart from** (prep. phrase)：除...之外
10. **residential** (adj.)：寄宿制的，提供住宿的
11. **establishments** (n.)：机构，建立物
12. **wider** (adj.)：更广泛的（the wider community：更广泛的社区群体）
13. **fortnight** (n.)：两星期，十四天
14. **liberal** (adj.)：通识的，博雅的（liberal education：通识教育）
15. **entitled** (adj.)：有资格的，有权享有的（be entitled to：有权获得...）

sections.title: Part II Reading Comprehension - Section B - Passage 1
sections.instructions: Read the following passages carefully and then select the best answer.

questions.text: Which of the following can best replace "were being purged of" in the first paragraph?

options.label: B

options.label: A

options.label: B

options.label: C

options.label: B

options.label: C

options.label: D

questions.text: What does “it” stand for in the last paragraph?

options.label: A
options.text: Inequality.

options.label: B
options.text: Education.

options.label: C
options.text: English.

options.label: D
options.text: Pakistan.

questions.text: Compared with Israel, what is the advantage of India in education?

options.label: A
options.text: Girl students are treated equally with boy students.

options.label: B
options.text: Students in India don't have to convert to English.

options.label: C
options.text: There is no distinction between religious schools and non-religious schools.

options.label: D
options.text: Indian schools are better resourced than Israeli schools.

sections.content:
PTV interviewed students who had obtained top positions in the matriculation examination in the country. One hafiz of Koran who had obtained top position said that in Israel children were only taught religion in the first 15 years, but in Pakistan the syllabi were being purged of Islam and Islamic seminaries were being closed down. A boy from Isakhel said that his area needed more colleges especially women's colleges. In the girls college in Isakhel there was only one teacher and the girls had to sit on the floor.

The information given by the hafiz boy on Israel is not correct. Israel is 97 per cent literate and girls' literacy is 93 per cent. The state-run institutions are not religious. There is a parallel system of religious schools run by the orthodox Jews but that is a minority. In state-run schools, there is no system of 15 years of purely religious education. The state of Israel has not yet been declared a religious state. It doesn't yet have a constitution. For all practical purposes it is a secular state with a strong presence of the religious parties in the Knesset because of Israel's proportional representation system.

One girl from Peshawar said that private schools had better quality because they taught from imported books. All the students agreed that in English medium schools science education was of better quality because science could not be translated into Urdu. In any case after matriculation students had to convert to English and thus English medium schools were essential. The boy from Isakhel confessed that Urdu did not help in science and that English is essential for which better teachers should be provided. The top students were more interested in saving the Islamic values.

The girl from Peshawar put her finger on a very important issue. What should we do about the English medium schools? Most politicians who want to change Pakistan and make it better want the English medium schools abolished in favor of equality. There is confusion here on two points. Do we want equality or uniformity? The ideologue wants uniformity of thought and most of us are for ideology as that would enable us better to combat the world. Do we want economic advancement from education or formation of personality? If both, then how do we maintain the balance? Urdu medium schools are at a disadvantage not only because they are less well resourced but also because their science students have to convert to English after matriculation. Across the border, India is less tortured over this issue.

sections.title: Part II Reading Comprehension - Section B - Passage 2
sections.instructions: Read the following passages carefully and then select the best answer.

questions.text: What does “there” refer to in the first paragraph?

options.label: A
options.text: Lahore.

options.label: B
options.text: Hang Ten.

options.label: C
options.text: Levis.

options.label: D
options.text: Cuckoo.

questions.text: What is out of the author's expectation?

options.label: A
options.text: The decoration and environment of the outlet.

options.label: B
options.text: The location of the outlet.

options.label: C
options.text: The marketing gimmick.

options.label: D
options.text: The date of the opening ceremony.

questions.text: Why Giordano has more male customers than female customers?

options.label: A
options.text: It offers more clothes for male than female.

options.label: B
options.text: Men have more time doing shopping.

options.label: C
options.text: The author does not give a reason.

options.label: D
options.text: Men like its style more than women do.

questions.text: What is the potential competitor of Giordano, according to its owner?

options.label: A
options.text: Levis.

options.label: B
options.text: Nike.

options.label: C
options.text: GAP.

options.label: D
options.text: Clarks.

questions.text: What can be concluded from the last paragraph?

options.label: A
options.text: Giordano should not put its advertisements on billboard.

options.label: B
options.text: People in Lahori prefer to shop in big stores.

options.label: C
options.text: Advertisements are important than the opening ceremony.

options.label: D
options.text: Giordano in Lahori does not quite understand the local psyche.

sections.content:
Lahorites can never run out of ideas. Be it brands like Hang Ten and Levis, eateries like Cuckoo's cafe and Gunsmoke, there's always something new happening. Giordano is good news for all those who wish to keep themselves updated with the latest trends. The brand is doing well in the cosmopolitan city. But then, what doesn't do well there? A famous name, a bit of style...that is all you need to make a place run successfully. Lahore is a different kind of market. Brands here need to offer something more than just their names. Established in 1981, Giordano places emphasis on good fabric and clean cuts, and thus has a relatively good chance of capturing the Lahori market.

The quiet opening ceremony was held on July 30th and that is probably the reason why most people don't even know Giordano has opened. Is that a marketing gimmick or just a blunder on their behalf? The outlet, located in a basement, is usually hard to find. It literally took me four rounds of the market before I could spot that GIORDANO board. When you think of a basement, you think of a dark gloomy place with spider webs all over. But walking down the stairs to this outlet makes you feel fresh and bright. The shop's interior is done in white, with big posters all over.

The idea is the outcome of a partnership between Mr. Janjua and Mr. Majid who own the sole distribution of Giordano in Lahore. According to them, the shop has been very successful so far, with the male customers proving to be much more responsive than the female ones. Could this be because our men have all the time in the world and are forever "on the round"?

When asked about Giordano's competitors in the market, Janjua said that the brand did not have any as such. He feels that Levis and Nike cater to a completely different segment and unless brands like GAP come into the market, Giordano faces no threat. Now that might be called living in a fools' paradise. People here normally have a perception that all international brands are good and alike. Giordano will have to offer something more than just the name and that might take time and effort.

The start could have been more exciting. People hardly know about the outlet, where it is, what they offer, etc. One billboard is not enough for a market that is surrounded by advertisements. We hope Giordano understands the Lahori psyche, which feels big is better!

sections.title: Part II Reading Comprehension - Section B - Passage 3
sections.instructions: Read the following passages carefully and then select the best answer.

questions.text: According to the author, what is neglected by the readers?

options.label: A
options.text: The source text.

options.label: B
options.text: The process of translation.

options.label: C
options.text: The final result of translation.

options.label: D
options.text: The translators' unique understanding of the source text.

questions.text: According to Bell, what is the reason for people's ignoring the process of translation?

options.label: A
options.text: People's understanding of the nature of translating is not adequate.

options.label: B
options.text: People think translation is the communication between language users.

options.label: C
options.text: There is no obvious development in translation studies over the years.

options.label: D
options.text: There is a tendency for people to put more emphasis on the result rather than on the process.

questions.text: Which word can best replace the word "embodiment" in Para. 2?

options.label: A
options.text: Expression.

options.label: B
options.text: Significance.

options.label: C
options.text: Symbolism.

options.label: D
options.text: Intention.

questions.text: What is important in translating metaphor?

options.label: A
options.text: To fully understand the original meaning.

options.label: B
options.text: To capture the special understanding of reality.

options.label: C
options.text: To avoid adding the translator's own point of view.

options.label: D
options.text: To achieve the best effect in the target language.

questions.text: Which word will the author use to describe the process of translation?

options.label: A
options.text: Passive.

options.label: B
options.text: Motivated.

options.label: C
options.text: Sclf-contained.

options.label: D
options.text: Self-generating.

sections.content:
It is in the nature of things that the target text displays only the translator's final decisions. Readers perceive an end-product, a result of a decision making process; they do not have access to pathways leading to decisions, to the dilemmas to be resolved by the translator. What is available for scrutiny is the end-product, the result of translation practice rather than the practice itself. In other words, we are looking at translation as product instead of translating as process. Bell suggests that the tendency to ignore the process involved in the act of translating lies behind the relative stagnation of translation studies in recent years. If we treat text merely as a self-contained and self-generating entity, instead of as a decision-making procedure and an instance of communication between language users, our understanding of the nature of translating will be impaired.

The view that underlies this book, then, is of translation as a process, involving the negotiation of meaning between producers and receivers of texts. In other words, the resulting translated texts are to be seen as evidence of a transaction, a means of retracing the pathways of the translators, decision-making procedures. In the same way, the source text is an end product and again should be treated as evidence of a writer's intended meaning rather than as the embodiment of the meaning itself. In translating metaphor, for example, there is little point in seeking to match target-language words with those in the source-language in isolation from a consideration of the writer's whole worldview. Occurrence of metaphor has a cumulative effect which suggests a particular perception of reality and it is this which the translator seeks to capture.

In this sense, texts can be seen as the result of motivated choice: producers of texts have their own communicative aims and select lexical items and grammatical arrangement to serve those aims. Naturally, in translating, there are potentially two sets of motivations: those of the producer of the source text and those of the translator.

options.label: C
